buildings.name: Eiffel Tower
buildings.fun_fact: It was constructed for the 1889 Exposition Universelle in Paris.

buildings.name: CCTV Headquarters
buildings.fun_fact: Because of its radical shape, it is said that a taxi driver first came up with its nickname dà kùchǎ (大裤衩), roughly translated as "big boxer shorts".

buildings.name: Great Pyramid of Giza
buildings.fun_fact: It's the oldest and last remaining of the original seven world wonders.

buildings.name: St. Peter's Basilica
buildings.fun_fact: It Took 120 Years To Build and was only finished in 1675.

buildings.name: Taj Mahal
buildings.fun_fact: The materials needed to build the Taj Mahal were transported with the help of over 1,000 elephants.

buildings.name: Empire State Building
buildings.fun_fact: The Empire State Building is an iconic skyscraper in New York City and was the tallest building in the world until 1970.

buildings.name: White House
buildings.fun_fact: The White House is the official residence and workplace of the President of the United States. It is an iconic symbol of American democracy and serves as a historic and political landmark in Washington, D.C.

buildings.name: Space Needle
buildings.fun_fact: The Space Needle is an observation tower and a prominent landmark in Seattle. Built for the 1962 World's Fair, it offers panoramic views of the city, including the downtown skyline, Elliott Bay, and the surrounding mountains.
